website_summaries.verdict: Mac users who need a fast portable hard drive will find it in the new My Passport Studio. Windows users should look elsewhere for a better deal.
pros: The WD My Passport Studio features all-metal scratch-resistant housing and supports FireWire 800 and USB 2.0 connections
The drive offers very good performance
cons: The My Passport Studio is comparatively expensive and doesn't have USB 3.0

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, portable storage!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photographer who uses a Macbook Pro 15" i7 and I just love this external harddrive. A lot of the harddrives I work with in my studio have to be plugged in the wall just for power but this one doesn't. It helps save a lot of space and makes the studio more organized. The transfer rate is pretty fast too. I'm just waiting for companies to start making Thunderbolt Harddrives. But that probably won't happen for a while. Now, if Mac's only had USB 3.0 then I would've bought another drive. But since firewire 800 is the only fast transfer peripheral device, I'd say that his harddrive is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Miraflor

customer_reviews.title: Well built and fast
customer_reviews.text: It's getting harder to find good portable firewire hard drives. Everything is moving to either USB3 or Thunderbolt and even Apple is starting to abandon Firewire, but I still don't have a USB3/Thunderbolt enabled Mac. Anyway, the WD Passport is a solid choice. It's well built with an aluminum enclosure. For a portable drive it's fast. According to BlackMagic Speed Test I'm getting 67MB/s write and 69 MB/s read. The drive also has a USB2 connection but it's not a standard mini-b connection which is annoying. I rarely ever use the USB connection anyway so no big deal. The USB transfer was noticeably slower at 28MB/s Write 36MB/s read.
customer_reviews.author: Colin

customer_reviews.title: Nicely built external storage for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Nicely built and works well. With TimeMachine on Mac, doing the backup was a breeze. (Unlike the thing on Windoz that does a system snapshot and won't let you restore individual files without undue effort.). I'm not using the software provided with it so I won't lower the rating for it. (I am using the software for another WD drive that I'm reviewing where I had intended to use their software. I'll blast them there). I partitioned the drive with space for backup on half and I'm using the other half for large files, like movies, that I don't want clogging up my main HD. I'm very pleased with this drive.
customer_reviews.author: Webwriter

customer_reviews.title: OK, But if Doing Time Machine with a New Mac Without Firewire....oops!
customer_reviews.text: I resorted to doing my Time Machine backup after delivery of the WD My Passport Studio portable drive using the enclosed USB vs the Firewire cable. The reason; there is not a Firewire input port on my new iMac. I had to order a Firewire to Thunderbolt dongle from Apple so that later I can continue to use the WD Passport drive ported to the Thunderbolt port. For some reason Apple did not design the new Macs with the Firewire input. I guess I will live with this, but when you add in the cost of the dongle, it jacks up the price to go to Firewire by another $30. Otherwise the external drive seems fast and a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas N. GilmoreTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A Year of Constant Use and Still Going
customer_reviews.text: I can't say this for at least three other external drives I've tried, but this one is still going strong. I use it every day for music and photos (and the music spins the drive constantly for hours upon hours). So, for now, I'm a WD fan and will likely need a larger one soon. It looks cool too -- matches the Mac. One negative: The little WD logo is made of die-cut metal and mine came split or something. I actually cut my finger pretty good on it with lots of blood...e[...] I just snipped it with pliers to fix it (the logo, not my finger ;p)
customer_reviews.author: M. Turner

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good performance
customer_reviews.text: I got this external hard drive as a good balance between affordable price and portability. So far it's been working fine. The unit is not much heavier than my 60 GB travel drive. The Firewire cable transfer is pretty quick. It transferred around 400 GB in under 2.5 hours. The WD software isn't excessive, but it is useful, including password protection. Finally, as a nice touch, the WD drive is designed for Macs and the aesthetics fit right next to a Mac. Definitely recommend this unit if you want 1 TB of extra storage (I assume the other sizes are just as good).
customer_reviews.author: Arnold

customer_reviews.title: WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage FireWire...
customer_reviews.text: I don't trust the cloud. I don't know who runs it and I don't know what they do with the data. I prefer my own data storage and that's why I bought the WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage. I won't know if it works or not until I have a HD-fail. I can assume it works because Western Digital has been around forever making reliable HDs. This is my kind of hardware - you plug it in and forget it.
customer_reviews.author: wolfmann123

customer_reviews.title: Solid hdd
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my iMac as an external hdd storage because i am replacing the internal hdd with a OCZ 256g ssd and for what im using it for it is working great so far. Came ready for mac all I had to do was plug it in. I love that this drive requires no power source and run off of the firewire for power. The build of the drive physically is extremely well built and looks very attractive. The aluminum on this drive blends in with my iMac and you almost cant see it sitting underneath my screen. Would recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: This is pure junk.
customer_reviews.text: This is pure junk, don't waste your money. I had this for a total of 6 months and it worked until yesterday. Now I can't access my files because the data structure is corrupt and unreadable. Online help told me to format the disc to fix the error. I did this and one day later, it happened again. Do not use as a backup. This is less reliable than a flash drive. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: Jimalya

customer_reviews.title: Constant use
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive every day for my streaming movies.
customer_reviews.author: B&S About Movies

customer_reviews.title: Need GB?
customer_reviews.text: If you are tired of 500 GB filing up to fast and transferring with 2.0 usb then get this, Firewire is great, super fast, I did not think there was really any difference but there is, I had to transfer software and sounds to my WD 1 TB External Hard Drive, over 350 GB, When super fast compared to my WD 500 GB 2.0 usb. Hate waiting, this is super fast, great housing and great case for carry. Get on, wont regret it.
customer_reviews.author: shawnvillegas

customer_reviews.title: Failed Twice for No Reason
customer_reviews.text: This external hard drive worked great...until it failed 8 months after I got it. I'd dropped it about a foot a few months before it failed, so I figured that was the cause. Fortunately it was under warranty, so I got a replacement drive. A year later, my replacement drive failed, this time for no apparent reason - I've never dropped it, unplugged it without ejecting first or anything like that. At this point, I could get another replacement, but I have no interest in an external hard drive that won't even last me a year. Moving on.
customer_reviews.author: Zara P.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic portable drive.
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive has been with me on my travels and it hasn't failed me yet. It's easy to use, and it doesn't require any power source besides being connected to my computer's USB port. I have been using it well over a year now and I haven't ever had a problem with it waking up when my computer tries to access it, unlike one of my other external hard drives. It's virtually silent when it operates and it's easy to throw in a computer bag and bring it with you. It's definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy good looking working as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I was looking around for comments on a 1To portable device, ...took the plundge on this one. Build and finish is excellent, seems very sturdy (still purchased a case to store it), transfer rates seems to be up there with other Firewire devices, straight forward to use, silent, ...what else would you ask for? I believe some of the best money can buy for a portable mac back up solution.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Tiny, quiet, and does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these drives to replace two Maxtor One-Touch Plus drives that failed on my Snow Leopard server. Plugs in and mounts to the desktop within instants. No external power supply, which makes it easy. Fast enough for my small Mac network, and small enough to free up space in the server close. I have an earlier model (non-metal case) that's been working flawlessly on the same server for a year. Recommended, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for an iMac
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace the internal drive in my computer so I first bought this Passport Studio to transfer all my data, then later returned the data onto the new internal drive. It was flawless. Customer support at Western Digital offers helpful phone support. This unit supplies the electrical power through the Firewire connection (or if you choose, USB), so there's one less item to plug in.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph H.

customer_reviews.title: 1TB Passport
customer_reviews.text: I bought this external hard drive to specifically use with my mac and cannot be any happier. The firewire cable included is AWESOME in that it makes transferring large files such as movies very fast. The look is very sleek and matched with my MBP unibody aluminum laptop. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Looks great and does a great job backing up.
customer_reviews.text: The Apple like case matches my MacBook nicely. I was able to quickly back up entire harddrive via Time Machine. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was the unpleasant amount of time it took to perform the initial encryption of the data. It literally took a couple of days. Placing a notice that the initial backup would take so long would have helped to ease my mind that I didn't do something wrong. I followed up with another backup two weeks later and it took less than a minute! So, overall I am very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd of Laytonsville

customer_reviews.title: Great Company, Great Drive
customer_reviews.text: My Mac crashed and along with it this western digital passport studio. I know that's not really an endorsement, but although the drive wouldn't communicate with my computer, the computer geniuses were able to salvage my data from this drive. I then had a really easy time filling out a claim online, returning the drive and getting a brand new one shortly thereafter.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Sc Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Use it everyday
customer_reviews.text: I use this to boot my Lion Partition on my work Mac (it still has leopard on it). It works great!!! Off firewire 800 I am able to boot into Lion and multitask with MS office and a couple of web pages pretty easily. I can run my Photo shop on it while booted but its not ideal (but good enough for some quick touch up editing. Great build quality as well.
customer_reviews.author: Snacks

customer_reviews.title: Great! No problems with iMac or XP laptop.
customer_reviews.text: I've had the 1 TB version for almost 5 months, and it's been great. I use it on both my iMac (via the Firewire 800 interface and an hfs+ partition) and an old Windows XP laptop (via the USB2 interface and an NTFS partition). The bus-powered feature works via either interface. I've never had a problem with it, and it's very quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I have a MacBook Pro, and this external hard drive works seamlessly, and as I had hoped. There where no problems backing up with Time Machine and the backup time was reasonably fast using FireWire connection. I've only had it for a short time (a month), so I'll have to see over the long haul. If anything changes, I add an update. As for now, I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: RCH

customer_reviews.title: My Passport Mac Edition
customer_reviews.text: Easily syncs instantly with Time Machine on my MacBook Pro right out of the box with no messy formatting. Plenty of space to continuously back up documents, pictures, music, etc. Not sure about the durability factor - hoping it lasts a while for the price, it's kept safe and stationary. So far, so good! Solid purchase for mac users purely for the simplicity of use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Wilbar

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last very long
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this hard drive even though it took a long time to do a backup. It seemed sturdy and well built, easy to use and very portable. I used it to back up my Mac since July 2012, but at some point in early 2015 this thing crapped out. So sad.
customer_reviews.author: Logan30

customer_reviews.title: Forget USB2
customer_reviews.text: I needed a fast backup drive for my MacBook Pro. USB2 was taking too long to back up, sometimes even having to cancel to start a new Time Machine run. This unit is FAST and built like a Sherman tank. I especially like not having to plug in an additional power cord. Keeps things nice and tidy.
customer_reviews.author: Datajockeys

customer_reviews.title: Good drive but verify the function of your iMac's FW800 port before buying!
customer_reviews.text: This drive works great via USB 2.0. Sadly, I purchased this to take advantage of the FW800 port on my late 2009 27" iMac which apparently doesn't work. After some research I've concluded that it's most likely the iMac's fault. Make sure you test your FW800 port before buying this or you might be stuck using it via USB like me.
customer_reviews.author: TurtleFoot

customer_reviews.title: If you have a new Mac, dont buy this port hard drive.
customer_reviews.text: If you are planning on using this on one of the new Macs, don't bother to spend the extra $ on firewire. The new Macs do not accept firewire only 3.0 USB. If using the USB cable on this hard drive it can only do 60 MB/s (480 Mbit/s)-Not the 800 firewire you are paying the extra money for.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for Mac/firewire enthusiasts
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hard drive! The fact that it has 2 firewire ports makes it even better, considering I had problems with firewire ports that stopped working in these hard drives in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Nicolas C.

customer_reviews.title: The drive died after 6 months of use - which ...
customer_reviews.text: The drive died after 6 months of use - which consisted of backing up my hard drive once a week.
customer_reviews.author: Bald Adventures

customer_reviews.title: I've used this drive for regular backups for over a ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used this drive for regular backups for over a year. Works well as does included security software. USB 2.0 and Firewire connections, though, are making it a bit obsolete since newer computers have USB 3.0 and often no Firewire ports.
customer_reviews.author: Crownbach

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: After a bit of research to replace a failed Seagate external hard drive that had failed for the 2nd time with the same problem, I decided on this Western Digital one. It arrived on time, was easy to set up, came formatted for Mac and worked out of the box. So far I am pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip E. Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Small 2 Terabyte capacity
customer_reviews.text: at two Tera Bytes, this does not have huge capacity these days
customer_reviews.author: Markus F. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup on Mac.
customer_reviews.text: All metal case. Came with a FireWire cable so that was nice. All I had to do was plug it in and Mac found it, asked if I wanted to set it up as a Time Machine, and my entire 1TB hard drive was backed up in about two hours. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great drive!
customer_reviews.text: I use this drive all the time! I went through a few others, but settled on this one. The Seagates don't seem to do well with an iMac, but WD drives are always reliable. I love the dual interface, but I've only had occasion to use the FireWire 800 interface.
customer_reviews.author: JP Fulks

customer_reviews.title: Very Solid and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised when I bought this 1TB hard drive how heavy it was. It's built of metal, to rival any of the other "mac" rated external hard drives. So far, it's been transferring files pretty fast, but the drive does heat up after a while. I'll probably be purchasing another one shortly.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hard Drive with Western My Passport Studio 1TB
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive has very high quality metal case with two firewire ports running daisy chain. The transfer is very fast and comes with two program to secure your data plus turbo function. I now connect two firewire hard drives together without any trouble. I highly recommend this product to any Mac user.
customer_reviews.author: Wing Lu

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: This item is pretty fast (I use it on a MAC with the firewire) and contrary to what I am worried about, it never really heats up. It's compact. I have not moved it much so no data has been lost yet. (if anything shall change in the future I will write a follow up review) I'd give it a 4.5 stars to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: didi sun

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little hard drive
customer_reviews.text: Looks great, built sturdy, perfect for bringing to gigs or for anything else. It's also decent for working off of as long as the project you are working on isn't too demanding. I will certainly buy more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Best drive so far
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my Time Machine backup for my iMac. This is the best external drive I have purchased thus far. If you use an iMac I suggest putting Velcro on the underside and mounting it to the back of your iMac. It works great and is out of site.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Great for backing up
customer_reviews.text: I used this device for backing up my MacBook pro hard drive. It is very convenient in size and feels like a very solid a device. I have several Western Digital drives that all perform very well. This one conveniently is powered from the Fire Wire cable allowing for remote use when a power plug is not readily available.
customer_reviews.author: G. Hoadley

customer_reviews.title: Great drive, have several of them durable but have ...
customer_reviews.text: Great drive, have several of them durable but have my doubts about it truly being in a metal case, seems like high end plastic. But hasn't failed me yet. be sure of which connection your using usb 2-3
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Does what an external drive should do!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this drive for a little over a year now and I have had no problems with. It works great with Time machine. Backups and transfers are fast thanks to FireWire. The metal casing feels very solid and has protected the drive from any damage.
customer_reviews.author: Someone Somewhere

customer_reviews.title: Great MAC/Apple
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my MacBook Pro. Easy to set up! Works great! Automatically connects with Time Machine to back up your MAC. If no back up is needed you can simple copy, cut, or drag docs or photos to it. You can also customize folders on the hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: PaulS

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy Case Logic Case Logic QHDC-101 Case for this HD
customer_reviews.text: The HD is solid, a bit heavy, well made quality and small. I bought this HD for video footage because it has FireWire 800 for my Mac. But this review is mainly to warn you don't buy the Case Logic QHDC-101 Portable EVA Hard Drive Case which was suggested under "Customer who bought this HD also bought . . ." but the case is too small for the HD. If you are looking to buy a case for this HD, the Case Logic PHDC-1 Portable Hard Drive Case (Magenta) would be better size.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina H.

customer_reviews.title: Works well for what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a school requirement for Pratt Institute(Art Major)...I'm not a computer whiz so only ordered what I was told to get . I do not have a Mac...luckily the IT guy at school was able to reformat it for me. So far...so good!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 359 days, lost lost of data ( it WAS my backup). I thought WD was good stuff, but now I don't think so. 3 of 3 passports died. Ok, I'm a slow learner. Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: Does what it's supposed to do.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this product for about a month and so far it seems to be functioning fine. I am a Macbook Pro user and chose this drive because it had firewire and because it was $35-40 cheaper than a comparable La Cie drive which I also found to be a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: particle 1844

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have to explain here the importance of an external hard drive. What I will say is the passport studio is a great plug and back up device. It is very simple and easy to use. One little tip I discovered, download the FireWire drivers from the WD website before you try to do an initial back up. Spent over an hour trying to get my system to back up when I first opened the box. After I downloaded the drivers I got the speed I was looking for in the back up.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent backup
customer_reviews.text: For backing up or just adding extra on line disk space this drive will provide great performance in a light weight package. A great buy to add a bit more life to your Macbook 17 since Apple don't make them any more.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Abercrombie

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I have always been very impressed with Western Digital products and found them to be reliable (which at the end of the day is what you're looking for with this type of product).
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Video Storage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an external for my son who creates videos on his MacBookPro. They take a LOT of digital space. This drive takes up very little physical space and is fast enough to edit directly from the drive.
customer_reviews.author: Robert B. Hailey

customer_reviews.title: Small, quiet
customer_reviews.text: I don't need a speedy drive, so I won't comment on the speed here. I use it for backup storage of some unimportant files. It's very quiet, compact and does not have annoying lights on the front. Definitely will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Bart Van Belle

customer_reviews.title: Great hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this over a year ago and am very happy I did. I had an older 500gb WD my book drive and it was starting to run a little slow. I use this as a partition drive, one partition for time machine and the other as an external drive.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E. Cote

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly with my Mac Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to back up my life that is currently stored on my Mac. It works wonderfully! Next step is to back up 8 years of email to it. Oh, boy!
customer_reviews.author: Saba Nigiri

customer_reviews.title: Great for backing up
customer_reviews.text: I have two mac computers and I use this to back up the files. The Firewire is faster than the usb and the few months Ive had it there have been no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa

customer_reviews.title: Unintrusive and Reliable
customer_reviews.text: I am using the WD HD with my Desktop Mac. With 1 TB of storage, I have made two partitions on the WD: one for backup and one for the Time Machine. I use the Firewire port to connect to the computer. It backs up quickly and silently. This device will be around my desk for a long time. The engineering has been well thought through. You can't go wrong with this product. It is also compatible with Windows.
customer_reviews.author: J. Vieira

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I dont know how well it will hold up a couple years down the line. Its hard to give reviews for electronics cause they all start out great. Well...most of the time they do.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia Wiggins

customer_reviews.title: Great drive
customer_reviews.text: Fast, reliable and stylish. The all-metal design is cool. Dual firewire makes it very convenient and flexible. So far it works great, but I've only had it for a couple of months. Good drive.
customer_reviews.author: AWM

customer_reviews.title: reliable external drive. good price.
customer_reviews.text: my current favorite drive. 1TB storage capacity. switched from LaCie rugged drives, since I was looking for a reliable, more cost effective drive. 2 firewire 800 ports. So far, no problems with this drive. They are little chunks of metal, so I tend to want to wrap them in duct tape or rubber or something when traveling with multiple drives. recommended
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Sharp

customer_reviews.title: Back up harddrive
customer_reviews.text: I chose this rating because I can't get the product to backup my Mac OS hard drive. After 12 hours at 90% on diagnostic testing nothing happened and I have tried to find how to set it to backup applications and documents, but nothing has happened so I have reverted to using my old Time Machine.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Downs

customer_reviews.title: Good FireWire External Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: It works perfectly with my Mac and it's very portable. It fits right in my MacBook sleeve. I also love the aluminum enclosure. The FireWire interface is twice as fast as USB 2.0. That's a big deal because my MacBook doesn't have USB 3.0. My MacBook has Thunderbolt, but not USB, which is why this drive is perfect for me.
customer_reviews.author: jfraser

customer_reviews.title: Mac backup
customer_reviews.text: The unit is compact and extraordinarily easy to use. Simply attaching the FireWire or USB between the Passport and the MacBook Pro then one click gets the backup processing.
customer_reviews.author: Allan G. Peck

customer_reviews.title: They are strong, sleep and durable.
customer_reviews.text: Have three of these. They are strong, sleep and durable. Only drawback is they are a tad heavy. Combo of USB and Firewire 800 is unbeatable though.
customer_reviews.author: R. McCall

customer_reviews.title: outstanding
customer_reviews.text: the perfect back up for an apple i-mac computer. fast, easy to install, compact and stylish. preprogrammed to work flawlessly with your apple.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis

customer_reviews.title: WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to augment/replace an older WD drive that was only 250MB, specifically because my Time Machine backups had eaten up all but 3.5MG of the available space. I'm using the firewire connection and all appears to be just fine. I'm afraid I don't know all the technical oohs and aahs, but this drive suits my purposes just fine. No complaints at all!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel W McNamara

customer_reviews.title: Drive works flawlessly - connected either as FireWire or USB
customer_reviews.text: I needed a hard drive to clone my iMac's internal hard drive. This drive fits the requirement perfectly. It run's very quietly, and includes both FireWire and USB cables.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This rugged fast hard drive is the bomb! I will be buying more if these. Great value, easy to format use. Happy happy happy!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Drive
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Drive, love that it is firewire and USB. I use this in a corporate environment for Mac support and it works flawlessly. I would recommend this to any Mac user for backup or extra storage. The metal case makes it a bit heavier than the standard plastic cases that most of the WD drives are enclosed in, but it does make it feel much sturdier.
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: Great Harddrive
customer_reviews.text: Came on time and works great. I didn't expect it to be formatted for apple devices but I just reformatted the drive and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Henry

customer_reviews.title: Use it with Time Machine
customer_reviews.text: Handy, small profile, does the job well for iMac; bought another one for more storage; very reliable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: canon on the hip

customer_reviews.title: it works very well w/ my air mac
customer_reviews.text: no complain because it just works very well as soon as you connect it. No problems so far and it's fast.
customer_reviews.author: Long Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Design and Performance
customer_reviews.text: This product performs very well. I use it for my iTunes Movies and TV Shows library where I play a movie (both HD and SD) directly from the hard drive and all the videos I watched played smoothly. I would not expect any less from WD. Cons: The stainless steel is very heavy for a portable hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: A. ALAQEEL

customer_reviews.title: Good until it stopped working.
customer_reviews.text: Initially impressed and was using it to back up my MBP, but it stopped working after a year...
customer_reviews.author: Papoo Tech

customer_reviews.title: WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage FireWire...
customer_reviews.text: WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage FireWire... works like it is supposed too. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JesusLover

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, dependable, great value for the money. Works with latest version of Mac OS X mountain lion. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Alesis

customer_reviews.title: Best external drive I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This drive is the perfect companion to a mobile rig with extra space needs. The firewire connection is super fast. Bus fed power is now a feature I will not do without. Rugged and extremely reliable so far.
customer_reviews.author: Earle

customer_reviews.title: Audio Drive
customer_reviews.text: I use it for audio back n forth between 3 studio machines. NEVER a problem. Fast as Firewire 8 should be and seems very sturdy and solid.
customer_reviews.author: RDTX

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Fast and good price.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to hold my iTunes and iPhoto library on. Works great No Complaints. My next HD will be thunderbolt for the computer I have now this is perfect. Dont buy a HD that need a power cord.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Holland

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Super-fast backups on my Mac G5 tower using firewire. Very impressive. Quiet. Sleek. Small. Black. Best backup device I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Jack White

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Drive works the way it is intended. Already formatted for Mac but can be reformatted for window. Good bang for buck.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Detroit

customer_reviews.title: Great external hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I used this to store all our home movies. Saved me from using all my internal memory space. Very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: 7373momma

customer_reviews.title: Great little hard drive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a portable time machine for my mac and it works great! I've no complaints about it. Great item for a great value.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Garrell

customer_reviews.title: Great for portable stuff.
customer_reviews.text: I put all my movies on this guy so anywhere i go, i can add, delete or watch any movie I own. excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have been very pleased with my purchase of this hard drive. It's pretty rugged, very compact and is very easy to use right out of the box. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Chemistry
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Excellent transfer speeds. Provides some flexibility in connection options, so I am able to easily back-up multiple Apple old/new computers with ease.
customer_reviews.author: J33T

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Hard Drive
customer_reviews.text: Solid construction and easy setup make this hard drive a must have. The Firewire 800 component makes transfer very fast. Nice small portable size for a nice price.
customer_reviews.author: WA P.

customer_reviews.title: high level
customer_reviews.text: awesome product..really useful kinda heavy though, but this product is all i need dor my daily work, must have this.. highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: vrianie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for wireless storage!
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive works flawlessly. I have it hooked up to my Airport Extreme so I can watch movies wirelessly. I can watch full HD movies over WiFi without skipping (granted, most of the credit should go to the Airport Extreme). I highly recommend it. Having Firewire 800 in addition to USB makes transferring movies a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: JLondon

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Took one minute to install and worked perfectly ever since. Good quality just right for the Mac. Quiet as can be
customer_reviews.author: WERNERAN

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job Done
customer_reviews.text: I'm normally not a western digital fan, but this drive is working great. I don't like the software sitting on the device so I'm steered clear. Firewire 800 never fails me though!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Street

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: It works fine & does everything I need it to do & the price was good. Received the item very promptly.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick W. Grau

customer_reviews.title: Great HD
customer_reviews.text: Easy to backup data from my MAC. Durably casing and very lightweight. Definitely would recommend this hard drive to anyone searching for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Vollmer

customer_reviews.title: Problem free
customer_reviews.text: This hard drive meets my needs for protecting the data on my personal MacBook. It does give one peace of mind. So far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: DougB.

customer_reviews.title: Firewire so good, I bought a second one
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I bought. I have Firewire 800 ports but no USB 3 so these two drives are Firewire for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D. Mckay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard drive for the Apple Mac
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 1TB version of the hard drive. I came pre-formatted for the Apple Mac and could start using it right off. It has two Firewire ports to allow you to daisy-chain more drives, though I haven't tried this as of now.
customer_reviews.author: DA

customer_reviews.title: Small and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed when I got this, because it's not that much bigger than my iPhone. No power chord necessary - just connect the firewire, and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Ric

customer_reviews.title: Good External HD
customer_reviews.text: I have an older MacBook Pro and use the firewire cable because its faster than my USB ports. 1TB should be plenty of space for whatever you're storing. The metal case seems sturdy and durable, although I have not dropped it.
customer_reviews.author: William Braskey

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: I've been using it for several months and it is really reliable, works ridiculously fast and it does not install anything to make it work, which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Jaczel Danilo Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 7 weeks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product December 14, 2012 and installed it on the day it arrived. It worked until February 7, 2013 when the drive began making faint grinding noises. I saw a dialogue box warning me that the drive had not been properly ejected. I had not ejected it al all, properly or improperly. I restarted the computer and it recognized the disk and appeared to be working. Soon the noise returned. Then the dialogue box returned. I again restarted the computer. The disk appears to be running but will not back up the mac mini. WD diagnostics program reports all is well. I do not believe it.
customer_reviews.author: JPC

customer_reviews.title: ... had this for about 2 years now and it's perfect! Works really well and I've not had one ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about 2 years now and it's perfect! Works really well and I've not had one problem with it.
customer_reviews.author: Martha C. Virtue

product_meta.title: WD My Passport Studio 1TB Mac Portable External Hard Drive Storage FireWire
product_meta.description:
My Passport Studio comes standard with two super-fast FireWire 800 ports, massive capacity, password protection, and a MacBook-inspired, metal enclosure that make this drive the ideal companion for Mac professionals. Compatible with: PC;Mac

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


MY PASSPORT STUDIO – PORTABLE HIGH SPEED STORAGE FOR MAC. 
My Passport® Studio™ comes standard with two super-fast FireWire® 800 ports and a MacBook®-inspired, metal enclosure make this drive the ideal companion for Mac professionals. 

High capacity, all metal design.
Offering high capacity in a small metal enclosure, My Passport Studio is the ideal companion for the photographer, videographer, graphic artist, or creative professional on the go. Dual FireWire 800 interfaces. 
Save and access data in blazing-fast speed of the two super-fast FireWire® 800 ports. Use the second FireWire port to daisy chain an additional external drive or other peripheral to your iMac®. Password protection secures your drive.
Use the WD Security utility to set password protection and hardware encryption and protect your files from unauthorized use or access. Features at a glance
 * High capacity in a compact design 
 * All metal enclosure
 * Two fast FireWire® 800 ports
 * Compatible with Apple® Time Machine®
 * Password protection and hardware encryption
 * 3-year limited warranty

Two FireWire 800 ports - With two super-fast FireWire® 800 ports, you can save and access data at up to 800 Mb/s. Use the second FireWire port to daisy chain an additional external drive or other peripheral to your Mac®. This drive also offers a USB 2.0 interface for added connectivity.

Premium aluminum enclosure - The durable, anodized aluminum enclosure is the perfect complement for your Mac computer and resists scratching and fingerprints.

WD Security™ - WD Security utility allows you to set password protection and hardware encryption for your drive to protect your files from unauthorized use or access.

WD Drive Utilities™ - Register your drive, set drive timer, run diagnostics and more using WD Drive Utilities.

High capacity, small enclosure - Offering high capacity in a small metal enclosure, My Passport Studio is the ideal companion for the photographer, videographer, graphic artist, or creative professional on the go.

Formatted for Mac - HFS+ Journaled so it works right out of the box with your Mac computer. Can be reformatted for Windows.

Compatible with Apple® Time Machine® - Back up your files with Apple Time Machine.

No power adapter required - The drive is powered through the FireWire or USB port, so there’s no need to lug around a bulky power adapter.

WD quality inside and out - We know your data is important to you. So we build the drive inside to our demanding requirements for durability, shock tolerance, and long-term reliability. Then we protect the drive with a robust enclosure designed for beauty and protection.

Ideal for

 * Transferring files with the blazing-fast FireWire® 800 interface
 * Adding extra storage for your videos, music, photos, and files
 * Using with your Mac® computer right out of the box
 * Backing up your files with Apple® Time Machine®
 * Securing your files from unauthorized access with password protection and hardware encryption

What's in the box
Portable hard drive, FireWire 800 cable, USB 2.0 cable, Quick Install Guide.

Compatibility
Formatted HFS+ Journaled for Mac OS® X Leopard®, Snow Leopard™ , or Lion™
Windows® XP, Windows Vista®, Windows 7 (requires reformatting)
Note: Compatibility may vary depending on user's hardware configuration and operating system.

For more great WD products, visit the Western Digital Store at Amazon.com
